intro: Heliotropium luteoviride, commonly known as the yellow heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to violet. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It is a member of the Nyctaginaceae family, known for its showy, often fragrant flowers. Heliotropium luteoviride is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
